H0.text: The emissions from volcanic activity are the environmental problem the EPA, established in 1970 to address environmental issues, is most likely interested in reducing.

H1.text: The level of pollution caused by people is what the EPA, established in 1970 to address environmental problems, is most likely interested in reducing.

H2.text: The amount of ozone in the stratosphere is what the EPA, established in 1970 to address environmental problems, is most likely interested in reducing.

H3.text: The amount of oxygen produced by trees is what the EPA is most likely interested in reducing, given that the EPA was established in 1970 to address environmental problems.

A4.text: Because of the impacts of these chemicals, local, country-level, and international policy have increasingly sought to regulate pollutants, resulting in increasing air and water quality standards, alongside regulation of specific waste streams.
